AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer.synopsis: AD for a mind flayer's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing who they used to be when they entered the pod.
AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Go to the Colony Tadpoling Centre (ReCon command "oe tc_teleport")- Interact with S_COL_TadpolingCentre_MemoryImprint_003_a49d018f-eede-4b58-932b-c3122881c689

PostCombat_Yeva.synopsis: Dialogue with Yeva after freeing her from his pod in the Colony Tadpoling Centre.
PostCombat_Yeva.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Go to the Colony Tadpoling Centre (ReCon command "oe tc_teleport")- Interact with the mind flayer device that controls the pod.- Select the "Release" option.- killcombat- Talk to Yeva.

AD_Manip_ColonyComment.synopsis: Behaviour AD from the Flaming Fist Manip after she is released from her pod in the mind flayer Colony's Tadpoling Centre. After the mind flayers are defeated, she will eventually make this comment about her surroundings.
AD_Manip_ColonyComment.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Go to the Colony Tadpoling Centre (ReCon command "oe tc_teleport")- Interact with the mind flayer device that controls the pod.- Select the "Release" option.- killcombat- The Flaming Fist Manip will make this comment after some time during her idle behaviour.

AD_MemoryImprint_004_Mindflayer.synopsis: AD for a memory imprint on an empty pod in the Tadpoling Centre.
AD_MemoryImprint_004_Mindflayer.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Go to the Colony Tadpoling Centre (ReCon command "oe tc_teleport")- Interact with S_COL_TadpolingCentre_MemoryImprint_004_e49beb7e-4a8c-4889-99f5-d09091b38860

PostCombat_Zevlor.synopsis: Dialogue with Zevlor after freeing him from his pod in the Colony Tadpoling Centre.
PostCombat_Zevlor.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Go to the Colony Tadpoling Centre (ReCon command "oe tc_teleport")- Interact with the mind flayer device that controls the pod.- Select the "Release" option.- killcombat- Talk to Zevlor.

PostCombat_Manip.synopsis: Dialogue with a Flaming Fist Manip, Ravengard's search officer, after freeing her from her pod in the Colony Tadpoling Centre.
PostCombat_Manip.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Go to the Colony Tadpoling Centre (ReCon command "oe tc_teleport")- Interact with the mind flayer device that controls the pod.- Select the "Release" option.- killcombat- Talk to the Flaming Fist Manip.

AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.synopsis: AD for Zevlor's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing a memory from before he was imprisoned here.
AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Go to the Colony Tadpoling Centre (ReCon command "oe tc_teleport")- Interact with S_COL_TadpolingCentre_MemoryImprint_006_ae82f0d7-6b72-43e9-a48e-0bdc184f4113

Pods.synopsis: Interacting with the mind flayer device in the Tadpoling Centre that controls the pods inside. You get to choose whether to free or purge the occupants of the pods - mind flayers and innocents alike.
Pods.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Go to the Colony Tadpoling Centre (ReCon command "oe tc_teleport")- Interact with the mind flayer device that controls the pod.

PAD_BrinePool_Tadpole.synopsis: The party reacts to spotting a special tadpole in one of the brine pools of the Colony Tadpoling Centre. It can be used for the tadpole powers tree.
PAD_BrinePool_Tadpole.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Go to the brine pools at the back of the Colony Tadpoling Centre: "oe tc_brine" or "goto 687 18 41"- Enable "roll amazing", and interact with the brine pool on the right-hand side.

AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer.synopsis: AD for a mind flayer's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing who they used to be when they entered the pod.
AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Go to the Colony Tadpoling Centre (ReCon command "oe tc_teleport")- Interact with S_COL_TadpolingCentre_MemoryImprint_005_aefdd6a6-f1c7-429f-8e9d-5a89cc31c960

AD_Mindflayers_EnterCombat.synopsis: The mind flayers in the pods in the Tadpoling Centre are released and enter combat with the players. They will say this AD simultaneously on the first mind flayer combat turn, only once.
AD_Mindflayers_EnterCombat.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Use the debugbook's "go to region" options to go to the Colony Tadpoling Centre (act 2)- Use either ReCon command "tc_releasepods", the debugbook quest flags and options, or just use the mind flayer device that controls the pods.- Mind flayers will all do this AD together in the first mind flayer combat turn.

AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer.synopsis: AD for a mind flayer's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing who they used to be when they entered the pod.
AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Go to the Colony Tadpoling Centre (ReCon command "oe tc_teleport")- Interact with S_COL_TadpolingCentre_MemoryImprint_007_1047a667-89ed-40c7-b7d0-e43779f57702

DaisyAD_BrinePool.synopsis: Brine pools. But they’ve been harvested. They should be full of tadpoles.

AD_MemoryImprint_009_Empty.synopsis: AD for an empty pod's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing a memory from whoever was imprisoned here before.
AD_MemoryImprint_009_Empty.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Go to the Colony Tadpoling Centre (ReCon command "oe tc_teleport")- Interact with S_COL_TadpolingCentre_MemoryImprint_009_1270e8ed-ca6e-4f0b-a801-b58dcd20c802

AD_Zevlor_Combat.synopsis: Zevlor is freed from his imprisonment in one the pods in the Colony Tadpoling Centre. This AD is played on his first combat turn with the mind flayers that were also released from the pods.
AD_Zevlor_Combat.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Go to the Colony Tadpoling Centre (ReCon command "oe tc_teleport")- Interact with the mind flayer device that controls the pods, and choose to release the occupants of the pods.- Zevlor will play this AD on his first combat turn in the resulting combat.

PAD_MizoraPodComment.synopsis: Players comment when approaching Mizora's pod in the back of the Tadpoling Centre, provided she is there.
PAD_MizoraPodComment.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Recruit Wyll through the debugbook- Use the debugbook to go to region -> COL -> Tadpoling Centre- Walk towards the back of the Tadpoling Centre, near Mizora's pod- This PAD will play upon entering S_COL_Mizora_PodApproach_Box_ab898639-200e-4cf5-a693-dcb27d3a4fcc

AD_Zevlor_Pod.synopsis: Repeated ADs from Zevlor, while he is (alive) inside one of the Colony's Tadpoling Centre pods. He is a bit dazed, mumbling about the events that lead up to his capture, mixed with traumatic memories of Elturel, Avernus, and his exile from his paladin order.
AD_Zevlor_Pod.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Use Recon command "oe tc_teleport"- Zevlor, if present (did not die before this point), will do repeated ADs while in the pod near 694; 18; 13

AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.synopsis: AD for Flaming Fist Yeva's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing a memory from before she was imprisoned here.
AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Go to the Colony Tadpoling Centre (ReCon command "oe tc_teleport")- Interact with S_COL_TadpolingCentre_MemoryImprint_008_5789f178-a7ce-4c2b-a104-598e9a711f28

DaisyAD_PodsComment.synopsis: Daisy AD when inside the Colony Tadpoling Centre. Daisy remarks on the occupants of the pods in the room (it is possible that all innocent occupants died before this point and there are only mind flayers in the pods). The Tadpoling Centre is where prisoners are transformed into mind flayers.
DaisyAD_PodsComment.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Use the debugbook to go to region -> COL -> Tadpoling Centre- Walk towards the centre of the Tadpoling Centre- This Daisy AD will play if the pods weren't purged or released.

AD_MemoryImprint_002_Manip.synopsis: AD for Shuurga's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing a memory from before she was imprisoned here.
AD_MemoryImprint_002_Manip.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Go to the Colony Tadpoling Centre (ReCon command "oe tc_teleport")- Interact with S_COL_TadpolingCentre_MemoryImprint_002_47c6ba7b-bc6b-4ed3-80bc-5bb90d169464

AD_MemoryImprint_001_Mindflayer.synopsis: AD for a mind flayer's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing who they used to be when they entered the pod.
AD_MemoryImprint_001_Mindflayer.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Go to the Colony Tadpoling Centre (ReCon command "oe tc_teleport")- Interact with S_COL_TadpolingCentre_MemoryImprint_001_aaf9bca7-87d9-410e-930d-14c83dd4de87

AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.synopsis: AD for an empty pod's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing a memory from Duke Ravengard, who was imprisoned here before.
AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Go to the Colony Tadpoling Centre (ReCon command "oe tc_teleport")- Interact with S_COL_TadpolingCentre_MemoryImprint_010_6f296af9-d391-414b-b62b-bb4bd961b91d

DarkUrgePod.synopsis: A player character interacts with a pod in the Tadpoling Centre that once belonged to the Dark Urge character. Other player characters may also investigate the pod, and imply something about who the pod belonged to if they succeed a skill check.
DarkUrgePod.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- "goto 678 18 41"- Interact with S_COL_TadpolingCentre_DarkUrgePod_1c7028d3-bb96-4bc5-8fb6-8b6e1d6a5e27- This interaction will be disabled if you enter the Colony without the Dark Urge in party/camp (meaning the DU would not exist in this playthrough). This only happens if you enter the Colony through gameplay or the debugbook. It will get re-enabled if you recruit the Dark Urge via debug.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: The sessions that involve freeing characters or triggering combat all stem from the interaction with the mind flayer device controlling the pods (the 'Pods' session). In other words, when a player interacts with the Pods and selects to release (or purge) the occupants, several follow‐up sessions are triggered. For example, the post‐combat dialogues with Yeva, Zevlor, and the Manip (PostCombat_Yeva, PostCombat_Zevlor, PostCombat_Manip) as well as the combat-related ADs (AD_Mindflayers_EnterCombat, AD_Zevlor_Combat, and AD_Manip_ColonyComment) all depend on that initial interaction with the device. In addition, Zevlor has an in-pod dialogue (AD_Zevlor_Pod) that will play only if he is still inside the pod (i.e. before he is freed); if the player instead frees him, then his in-pod dialogue is skipped in favor of the freed/first combat dialogue. Furthermore, if Zevlor dies (Zevlor_Dead), none of his free/combat-related dialogues (or the in-pod repeated dialogue) can occur. Finally, there is a DaisyAD_PodsComment session that is triggered when the pods have not been tampered with (i.e. when the player has not gone through the device’s release/purge route). This makes DaisyAD_PodsComment mutually exclusive with any sessions that result from an active decision on the Pods device. These observations lead us to define the following ordering and exclusiveness rules.

AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer_0.text: *Desperation... pain... terror. Cultists raided his village - he was the sole survivor.*

AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer_1.text: *The device releases a stream of fragmented memories and emotions - all that remains of the pod inhabitant's former self.*

AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer_3.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer_3.text: *The device does not react to your touch or presence.*

PostCombat_Yeva_4.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
PostCombat_Yeva_4.text: I don't know how to thank you. I thought I was done for.

PostCombat_Yeva_7.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
PostCombat_Yeva_7.text: This is a bleeding shitshow. Half my squad's dead, the other half's sporting tentacles.

PostCombat_Yeva_1.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
PostCombat_Yeva_1.text: We came here to rescue Duke Ravengard, but we didn't stand a chance.

PostCombat_Yeva_12.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
PostCombat_Yeva_12.text: Yeah. He was in one of the pods, but the cultists took him away.

PostCombat_Yeva_9.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
PostCombat_Yeva_9.text: He was still human. And still trying to put up a fight.

PostCombat_Yeva_11.speaker: Player
PostCombat_Yeva_11.text: Are you sure Ravengard's down here?

PostCombat_Yeva_13.speaker: Player
PostCombat_Yeva_13.text: Is the Duke someone who rewards well?

PostCombat_Yeva_5.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
PostCombat_Yeva_5.text: Yes he does. A mercenary are you?

PostCombat_Yeva_10.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
PostCombat_Yeva_10.text: You've got more courage than sense if you're planning to go deeper. But someone needs to.

PostCombat_Yeva_3.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
PostCombat_Yeva_3.text: The cultists took Ravengard when they locked us up. He was still human last I saw him. Still trying to put up a fight.

PostCombat_Yeva_8.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
PostCombat_Yeva_8.text: A couple of those flayers were comrades of mine. I'd have been trying to suck your brains out along with 'em if you'd arrived any later.

AD_Manip_ColonyComment_1.speaker: Manip Shuurga
AD_Manip_ColonyComment_1.text: That smell - I can feel it in my throat. I'll never be rid of it.

AD_Manip_ColonyComment_0.speaker: Manip Shuurga
AD_Manip_ColonyComment_0.text: There'll be hells to pay for this, if I make it out of here alive.

AD_MemoryImprint_004_Mindflayer_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_004_Mindflayer_0.text: *The device does not react to your presence.*

PostCombat_Zevlor_43.speaker: Narrator
PostCombat_Zevlor_43.text: *Confusion crosses Zevlor's eyes as he takes you in.*

PostCombat_Zevlor_45.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_45.text: I thought I was done for... Thank you... Watching gods - the Blade of Frontiers? Wyll? What happened?

PostCombat_Zevlor_39.speaker: Player
PostCombat_Zevlor_39.text: I paid the price of angering the wrong devil.

PostCombat_Zevlor_41.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_41.text: And shouldered the cost to spare someone else a worse fate, I'd wager.

PostCombat_Zevlor_53.speaker: Player
PostCombat_Zevlor_53.text: I figured I was due a makeover. What do you think?

PostCombat_Zevlor_55.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_55.text: If I know you at all, you chose this fate to spare someone else a worse one. So I think it suits you.

PostCombat_Zevlor_28.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_28.text: Hells... I didn't think I was going to make it. Thank you...

PostCombat_Zevlor_11.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_11.text: Watching gods - the Blade of Frontiers? Wyll? What happened?

PostCombat_Zevlor_5.speaker: Wyll
PostCombat_Zevlor_5.text: I paid the price of angering the wrong devil.

PostCombat_Zevlor_31.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_31.text: And shouldered the cost to spare someone else a worse fate, I'd wager.

PostCombat_Zevlor_48.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_48.text: Finish what you came here to do - I daresay you've done enough for me.

PostCombat_Zevlor_17.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_17.text: I... owe you an explanation. Much more than that. But first, please...

PostCombat_Zevlor_10.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_10.text: The others. The ambush - tell me they survived.

PostCombat_Zevlor_51.speaker: Player
PostCombat_Zevlor_51.text: You abandoned them. Do you really think you have the right to ask?

PostCombat_Zevlor_64.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_64.text: I do not. But if you know what happened... well, you deserve to know all of it.

PostCombat_Zevlor_37.speaker: Player
PostCombat_Zevlor_37.text: Some. Others ended up in a cell in Moonrise. That's on you.
PostCombat_Zevlor_37.context: InternalNodeContext: |Needs appropriate flag checks for various fates of Tieflings.|

PostCombat_Zevlor_25.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_25.text: Somehow, I suspect it's worse even than you imagine. Likely you heard that I broke, or froze, or some other lie kinder than the truth.

PostCombat_Zevlor_24.speaker: Player
PostCombat_Zevlor_24.text: The only survivors ended up in a cell in Moonrise.

PostCombat_Zevlor_60.speaker: Player
PostCombat_Zevlor_60.context: InternalNodeContext: |Needs appropriate flag checks for various fates of Tieflings.|

PostCombat_Zevlor_57.speaker: Player
PostCombat_Zevlor_57.text: They found refuge. But what the hells happened out there, Zevlor?

PostCombat_Zevlor_1.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_1.text: You've heard some of it, I'm sure. That I froze, or broke, or some other lie that is kinder than the truth.

PostCombat_Zevlor_62.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_62.text: We were ambushed by cultists, yes. And then I heard... Her. Their false god, whispering promises in my mind.

PostCombat_Zevlor_19.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_19.text: I would be a paladin again - with a god's purpose, a god's power. Everything I needed to protect my people.

PostCombat_Zevlor_18.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_18.text: And all the while, the cult tortured them. They fought, and ran, and died around me, while I imagined myself their saviour.
PostCombat_Zevlor_18.context: NodeContext: No heat or self-pity - just the clarity of his failure

PostCombat_Zevlor_16.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_16.text: By the time I regained my senses, it was too late. I did not just surrender to the Absolute. For a moment, I welcomed it.

PostCombat_Zevlor_46.speaker: Player
PostCombat_Zevlor_46.text: Be honest. You wanted the power, but not for any ideal - for yourself.

PostCombat_Zevlor_0.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_0.text: An ugly thought. With the echo of truth to it.

PostCombat_Zevlor_63.speaker: Player
PostCombat_Zevlor_63.text: If you wanted power, you never needed a god - only to live up to your ideal.

PostCombat_Zevlor_20.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_20.text: I fell short of that mark in Avernus - and even so, it was not so bad as this.

PostCombat_Zevlor_23.speaker: Player
PostCombat_Zevlor_23.text: 'For a moment' - until you realised your reward would be a tadpole.

PostCombat_Zevlor_40.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_40.text: Until I realised what I'd done. Perhaps I fought - I don't recall. Either way, I was deemed... unworthy of becoming a True Soul.

PostCombat_Zevlor_59.speaker: Player
PostCombat_Zevlor_59.text: It sounds like you were being enthralled. It's not your fault.

PostCombat_Zevlor_12.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_12.text: It would be nice to think so. But whatever these monsters twist us into... I believe it begins in us.

PostCombat_Zevlor_13.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_13.text: I won't make excuses. I can't make amends. But I know something of what you came to do - I want to help, if you'll let me.

PostCombat_Zevlor_26.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_26.text: Ketheric is below. He thinks you're no longer a menace. Descend and show him how wrong he is.

PostCombat_Zevlor_33.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_33.text: If there are any more survivors to be found, I'll find them - and lead them out of this place.

PostCombat_Zevlor_38.speaker: Player
PostCombat_Zevlor_38.text: I could use another blade in the fight to come.

PostCombat_Zevlor_44.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_44.text: Only if you can trust it won't be buried in your back. The Absolute swayed me once before. I won't risk it happening again.

PostCombat_Zevlor_30.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_30.text: Go, my friend. Please. Let me do this much.

PostCombat_Zevlor_27.speaker: Player
PostCombat_Zevlor_27.text: Find your own people. They need you.

PostCombat_Zevlor_47.speaker: Player
PostCombat_Zevlor_47.text: I don't care what you do - just get out of my sight.

PostCombat_Zevlor_2.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_2.text: As you wish. I'll pray for your success, to any god who will listen.

PostCombat_Zevlor_58.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_58.text: And you, my friend. And pathetic, inadequate as it is - thank you.

PostCombat_Zevlor_36.speaker: Player
PostCombat_Zevlor_36.text: Your people didn't need a paladin - they saved themselves.

PostCombat_Zevlor_21.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_21.text: They did? Oh sweet gods. I have no right to feel it - but I am proud of them.

PostCombat_Zevlor_3.speaker: Zevlor
PostCombat_Zevlor_3.text: The Blade of Frontiers. The saviour I needed, if not the one I deserved.

PostCombat_Manip_0.speaker: Manip Shuurga
PostCombat_Manip_0.text: On the other hand, maybe I'll just live for revenge. Yeah, by Gruumsh! That sounds like a plan.

PostCombat_Manip_2.speaker: Manip Shuurga
PostCombat_Manip_2.text: Hurr, what a stench. I'm beginning to think I should have stayed in that pod. In there it only smelled like me.

PostCombat_Manip_1.speaker: Manip Shuurga
PostCombat_Manip_1.text: Is there any news about Duke Ravengard? Did he get out alive? No, I can tell by your expression. I'm going to have to fall on my sword, aren't I?

AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor_2.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor_2.text: *You remember the shattered windows of Elturel's High Cathedral, the burning black sky of Avernus beyond.*

AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor_0.text: *In its horror, the Blood War unites you. Tiefling, dwarf and elf alike huddle behind the shields of your paladin order, waiting for salvation. But when it comes... disunity.*

AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor_1.text: *The returned city casts your people out, the devils who dragged them down to hell. In the end, it is not your paladin oath that is broken: it is your faith itself.*

AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor_3.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor_3.text: *The pod lies empty, echoing - no mind to draw on within.*

Pods_1.speaker: Narrator
Pods_1.text: *You connect to the device, and gain control of the pods - and the fate of their occupants.*

Pods_7.speaker: Narrator
Pods_7.text: *The device is open to your tadpole's command - to your authority.*

Pods_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: |*The pods slide open, its occupants released. We cut to gameplay before seeing the occupants leave the pods.*|

Pods_11.speaker: Narrator
Pods_11.text: *There is no visible means of operating the device.*

Pods_17.speaker: Narrator
Pods_17.text: *Your tadpole forms a telepathic connection with the device, and chorus of static energy fills your mind.*

Pods_6.speaker: Narrator
Pods_6.text: *Every mind flayer in the room calls out hungrily from its pod, seeking release. And sustenance.*

Pods_5.speaker: Narrator
Pods_5.text: *But there are others in the pods - those not yet infected, not yet illithid. Terrified, desperate to escape.*

Pods_15.speaker: Lae'zel
Pods_15.text: Ghaik machinery. Cold as the Sea of Night, alien as time to the Astral Plane. Avert your eyes, close your mind.

PAD_BrinePool_Tadpole_0.speaker: Player
PAD_BrinePool_Tadpole_0.text: An unusual parasite, here. It's - it's reaching out to me.

AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer_0.text: *The device does not react to your touch or presence.*

AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer_1.text: *The device releases a stream of fragmented memories and emotions - all that remains of the pod inhabitant's former self.*

AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer_3.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer_3.text: *Courage... conviction... defiance. Even as her organs began to dissolve, she believed she could resist.*

AD_Mindflayers_EnterCombat_0.context: NodeContext: This line will be spoken by multiple mind flayers at the same time. They should sound as similar as possible - same start time, duration and intonation.

AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer_0.text: *Delirium... mania... laughter. His mind broke before the end, and he was laughing uncontrollably as the skin fell from his face.*

AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer_1.text: *The device releases a stream of fragmented memories and emotions - all that remains of the pod inhabitant's former self.*

AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer_3.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer_3.text: *The device does not react to your touch or presence.*

DaisyAD_BrinePool_0.text: Brine pools... but empty of tadpoles. Unusual. Harvesting all the larvae indicates they are getting ready for something big.

Zevlor_Dead_22.speaker: Player
Zevlor_Dead_22.text: Who put you in that pod?

Zevlor_Dead_2.speaker: Player
Zevlor_Dead_2.text: Why did you surrender your people to the cult?

Zevlor_Dead_6.speaker: Zevlor
Zevlor_Dead_6.context: NodeContext: First spark of cognition - that something is wrong. You're trying to remember what happened to the others you brought with you (they were butchered, but you don't remember that yet)

Zevlor_Dead_5.speaker: Player
Zevlor_Dead_5.text: What did the voice of the Absolute promise you?

Zevlor_Dead_19.speaker: Zevlor
Zevlor_Dead_19.text: To be... paladin again... protect... my people...

Zevlor_Dead_16.speaker: Zevlor
Zevlor_Dead_16.text: My... people... where are... my people...?

Zevlor_Dead_14.speaker: Player
Zevlor_Dead_14.text: Many of your people died. Because of you.

Zevlor_Dead_26.speaker: Zevlor
Zevlor_Dead_26.text: No... we are... sainted... safe... home...

Zevlor_Dead_8.speaker: Zevlor
Zevlor_Dead_8.text: Down... in the dark... down... down...

Zevlor_Dead_1.speaker: Narrator
Zevlor_Dead_1.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Zevlor_Dead_24.speaker: Narrator
Zevlor_Dead_24.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Zevlor_Dead_27.speaker: Narrator
Zevlor_Dead_27.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

AD_MemoryImprint_009_Empty_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_009_Empty_0.text: *The device does not react to your presence.*

AD_Zevlor_Combat_0.speaker: Zevlor
AD_Zevlor_Combat_0.text: Enough! My mind is my own!

PAD_MizoraPodComment_0.speaker: Player
PAD_MizoraPodComment_0.text: That pod - is that Mizora inside?

AD_Zevlor_Pod_0.speaker: Zevlor
AD_Zevlor_Pod_0.context: NodeContext: Recalling when the ambush went wrong - his people started to fight and die

AD_Zevlor_Pod_1.speaker: Zevlor
AD_Zevlor_Pod_1.context: NodeContext: Vague, getting confused - his time in the shadowlands blurring with his time in hell, when he was a paladin

AD_Zevlor_Pod_2.speaker: Zevlor
AD_Zevlor_Pod_2.context: NodeContext: Mumbling 'The Absolute is giving us a chance'

AD_Zevlor_Pod_3.speaker: Zevlor
AD_Zevlor_Pod_3.context: NodeContext: Recalling trying to persuade his people (he was being mind controlled)

AD_Zevlor_Pod_4.speaker: Zevlor
AD_Zevlor_Pod_4.text: Elturel... Avernus... the sky is burning...
AD_Zevlor_Pod_4.context: NodeContext: Vague, getting confused - his time in the shadowlands blurring with his time in hell, when he was a paladin

AD_Zevlor_Pod_5.speaker: Zevlor
AD_Zevlor_Pod_5.text: Children... look away... look at me...
AD_Zevlor_Pod_5.context: NodeContext: Recalling when the ambush went wrong - his people started to fight and die

AD_Zevlor_Pod_6.speaker: Zevlor
AD_Zevlor_Pod_6.context: NodeContext: Recalling trying to persuade his people (he was being mind controlled)

AD_Zevlor_Pod_7.speaker: Zevlor
AD_Zevlor_Pod_7.text: The Absolute... the Absolute will save us...
AD_Zevlor_Pod_7.context: NodeContext: Vague, getting confused - his time in the shadowlands blurring with his time in hell, when he was a paladin

AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva_1.text: *Your lungs burn with the dry heat of the fires raging about you, but the pain is not enough to diminish your swing. One goblin after another falls to your blade.*

AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva_2.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva_2.text: *A man's voice cries out through the thick smoke. 'Ravengard!' you call, but the clang of swords and the spell-shouts of attacking drow are your only reply.*

AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva_3.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva_3.text: *The device does not react to your touch or presence.*

AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva_4.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva_4.text: *The device releases a stream of fragmented memories and emotions - all that remains of the pod inhabitant's former self.*

AD_Minthara_EnteredTadpolingCenter_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_EnteredTadpolingCenter_0.text: This place has been used to make slaves of those who should be masters.

DaisyAD_PodsComment_0.text: Mind flayers, still in their pods... This must be where they transform those they kidnap.

DaisyAD_PodsComment_1.text: Mind flayers and civilians side by side...

DaisyAD_PodsComment_2.text: This must be where they infect and transform those they kidnap.

AD_MemoryImprint_002_Manip_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_002_Manip_0.text: *This pod pulsates with the angry memories of Ravengard's search officer, Manip Shuurga. She laments her failure to locate him.*

AD_MemoryImprint_002_Manip_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_002_Manip_1.text: *This pod is empty, bereft of memories but for a single waft of frustrated fury.*

AD_MemoryImprint_001_Mindflayer_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_001_Mindflayer_0.text: *The device releases a stream of fragmented memories and emotions - all that remains of the pod inhabitant's former self.*

AD_MemoryImprint_001_Mindflayer_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_001_Mindflayer_1.text: *Amusement... curiosity... fascination. He believed the horrors of Moonrise to be a fleeting dream that fade on waking.*

AD_MemoryImprint_001_Mindflayer_2.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_001_Mindflayer_2.text: *The device does not react to your touch or presence.*

AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard_5.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard_5.text: *Though the pod is empty, traces of psychic energy still linger around it, and memories of its former inhabitant spill into your mind.*

AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard_3.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard_3.text: *You see the streets of Baldur's Gate... the emblem of the Flaming Fist... martial drills and courtly dances.*

AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard_1.text: *And then, clearer than any other image, the face of a child. Your face, smiling proudly as you follow your father, Duke Ravengard, through the corridors of the great fortress at Wyrm's Rock.*

AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard_4.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard_4.text: *The image soon fades, but a shadow of his presence remains. He was here, in this pod, not long ago.*

AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard_2.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard_2.text: *You feel the courage of a soldier who became a commander, and the intelligence of a commander who became a Duke.*

AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard_0.text: *Ravengard was here, in this pod, not long ago.*

DarkUrgePod_5.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod_5.text: *This was the pod of someone who was among the very first to be tadpoled - the blood inside is already stale.*

DarkUrgePod_9.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod_9.text: *Perhaps even this very pod was your prison... where were you first captured? It's impossible to remember...*

DarkUrgePod_15.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod_15.text: *This mind-flayer pod is not only empty, it looks abandoned.*

DarkUrgePod_20.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod_20.text: *This pod has a different air to its chitinous cavern. Dust and dirt gather on the inside.*

DarkUrgePod_12.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod_12.text: *This pod's inhabitant must have taken a lot of damage while they were inside.*

DarkUrgePod_16.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod_16.text: *This was the pod of someone who was among the very first to be tadpoled - the blood inside is already stale.*

DarkUrgePod_18.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod_18.text: *Its inhabitant is long gone... and not peacefully.*

DarkUrgePod_21.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod_21.text: *This was the pod of someone whose tadpoling happened bloodily: they damaged themselves fighting back.*

DarkUrgePod_30.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod_30.text: *This pod has a different air to its chitinous cavern. Dust and dirt are gathered on the inside.*

DarkUrgePod_27.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod_27.text: *It's broken beyond repair. Seemingly by a blunt impact, as if whoever was inside threw themselves against it in an effort to break out.*
DarkUrgePod_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark Urge bends down next to the pod, to look into the area beyond the glass, it doesn't have to be shown

DarkUrgePod_11.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod_11.text: *Your brain hurls an image towards you. Your own head-blood gushing down in front of your eyes.*

DarkUrgePod_3.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod_3.text: *Banging your fists on a chamber until half your fingers were broken. How long inside? Days? Months? Lifetimes?*

DarkUrgePod_22.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod_22.text: *The parasite was inserted into your head, and your body crammed into a pod long before you were moved to the nautiloid.*

DarkUrgePod_29.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod_29.text: *A laughing woman, taunting you... She betrayed you... Who was she?*

DarkUrgePod_2.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod_2.text: *You were in the pod a long, long while, but it seems you have no recollection of ever entering the nautiloid.*

DarkUrgePod_6.speaker: Player
DarkUrgePod_6.text: Try to discern how long this pod has been empty.

DarkUrgePod_32.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod_32.text: *The blood inside has not started to rot. There is a fresh hint to it.*

DarkUrgePod_19.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod_19.text: *These pods are made to preserve. Time means nothing.*

DarkUrgePod_0.speaker: Player
DarkUrgePod_0.text: Humour me, Astarion, can you give this blood a smell?

DarkUrgePod_23.speaker: Astarion
DarkUrgePod_23.text: Oh yes, that's yours all right. Even stale, I'd recognise that bouquet anywhere.

DarkUrgePod_28.speaker: Astarion
DarkUrgePod_28.text: Excuse me? I'm not some bloodhound tracking your scent. I'm of a much higher pedigree.
